habitat.description: Liches establish lairs in fortified crypts, abandoned dwarf caverns, or pocket dimensionsâ€”anywhere isolated enough to pursue their arcane research undisturbed. Their domains, called 'dooms,' feature twisting labyrinths guarded by undead servants and constructs, with hidden chambers protecting their phylacteries.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.description: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed lich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.description: The lich has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

actions.name: Paralyzing Touch
actions.description: Melee Spell Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) cold damage. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute.

legendaryActions.description: The lich can take 3 legendary actions.

actions.name: Paralyzing Touch
actions.description: The lich uses its Paralyzing Touch.

actions.name: Frightening Gaze
actions.description: The lich fixes its gaze on one creature it can see within 10 feet. DC 18 Wisdom save or frightened for 1 minute.

actions.name: Disrupt Life
actions.description: Each non-undead creature within 20 feet must make a DC 18 Constitution save, taking 21 (6d6) necrotic damage on a failed save.
